title: Check the legal statement and make your declaration
intro: This statement is based on the information you’ve given in your application. It will be stored as a public record.
intro-multipleApplicants: This statement is based on the information {applicantName} has given in their application. It will be stored as a public record.
highCourtHeader: In the High Court of Justice
legalStatementApplicant: I, {applicantName} of {applicantAddress}, make the following statement:
legalStatementDeceased: {deceasedName} was born on {deceasedDob} and died on {deceasedDod}, domiciled in England and Wales.
deceasedEstateHeader: The estate of the person who died
deceasedEstateValue: The gross value for the estate amounts to £{ihtGrossValue} and the net value for the estate amounts to £{ihtNetValue}.
deceasedEstateLand: To the best of my knowledge, information and belief, there was no land vested in {deceasedName} which was settled previously to the death (and not by the will) of {deceasedName} and which remained settled land notwithstanding such death.
deceasedEstateLand-multipleApplicants: To the best of our knowledge, information and belief, there was no land vested in {deceasedName} which was settled previously to the death (and not by the will) of {deceasedName} and which remained settled land notwithstanding such death.
applicantName: I am an executor named in the will as {applicantWillName}, and I am applying for probate.
applicantName-alias: I, {applicantCurrentName}, an executor named in the will as {applicantWillName}, am applying for probate. My name is different because{aliasReason}.
applicantName-codicils: I am an executor named in the will or codicils as {applicantWillName}, and I am applying for probate.
applicantName-alias-codicils: I, {applicantCurrentName}, an executor named in the will or codicils as {applicantWillName}, am applying for probate. My name is different because{aliasReason}.
applicantName-multipleApplicants: {applicantCurrentName}, an executor named in the will{applicantNameOnWill}, is applying for probate.
applicantName-multipleApplicants-alias: {applicantCurrentName}, an executor named in the will{applicantNameOnWill}, is applying for probate. Their name is different because {applicantCurrentName}{aliasReason}.
applicantName-multipleApplicants-codicil: {applicantCurrentName}, an executor named in the will or codicils{applicantNameOnWill}, is applying for probate.
applicantName-multipleApplicants-alias-c: {applicantCurrentName}, an executor named in the will or codicils{applicantNameOnWill}, is applying for probate. Their name is different because {applicantCurrentName}{aliasReason}.
applicantName-multipleApplicants-mainApp: {applicantWillName}, an executor named in the will, is applying for probate.
{applicantCurrentName}, an executor named in the will as {applicantWillName}, is applying for probate. Their name is different because {applicantCurrentName}{aliasReason}.
{applicantWillName}, an executor named in the will or codicils, is applying for probate.
{applicantCurrentName}, an executor named in the will or codicils as {applicantWillName}, is applying for probate. Their name is different because {applicantCurrentName}{aliasReason}.
applicantSend: I will send to the probate registry what I believe to be the true and original last will and testament of {deceasedName}.
applicantSend-codicils: I will send to the probate registry what I believe to be the true and original last will and testament, and {codicilsNumber} {codicils} of {deceasedName}.
applicantSend-multipleApplicants-mainApp: {applicantName} will send to the probate registry what we have seen and believe to be the true and original last will and testament of {deceasedName}.
{applicantName} will send to the probate registry what we have seen and believe to be the true and original last will and testament, and {codicilsNumber} {codicils} of {deceasedName}.
executorNotApplyingReason: {otherExecutorName}, an executor named in the will, is not making this application {otherExecutorApplying}
executorNotApplyingReason-codicils: {otherExecutorName}, an executor named in the will or codicils, is not making this application {otherExecutorApplying}
optionPowerReserved: but reserves power to do so at a later date.
optionRenunciated: now and gives up the right to do so in the future.
optionMarried: Married or in a civil partnership
optionDivorced: Divorced or their civil partnership was dissolved
additionalExecutorNotified: They have been notified in writing.
declarationConfirm: I confirm that I will administer the estate of {deceasedName}, according to law. I will:
declarationConfirm-multipleApplicants: We confirm that we will administer the estate of {deceasedName}, according to law. We will:
declarationConfirmItem2: keep full details (an inventory) of the estate
declarationConfirmItem3: keep a full account of how the estate has been administered
declarationConfirmItem3-intestacy: keep a full account of how the estate has been distributed
declarationRequests: If the probate registry (court) asks me to do so, I will:
declarationRequests-multipleApplicants: If the probate registry (court) asks us to do so, we will:
declarationRequestsItem1: provide the full details of the estate and how it has been administered
declarationRequestsItem1-intestacy: provide the full details of the estate and how it has been distributed
declarationRequestsItem2: return the grant of probate to the court
declarationRequestsItem2-intestacy: return the letters of administration to the court
declarationUnderstandItem1: my application will be rejected if I do not answer any questions about the information I have given
declarationUnderstandItem1-multipleAppli: our application will be rejected if we do not answer any questions about the information we have given
declarationUnderstandItem1-intestacy: my application will be rejected if I do not provide information (if asked)
declarationUnderstandItem2: proceedings for contempt of court may be brought against the undersigned if it is found that the evidence provided is deliberately untruthful or dishonest, as well as revocation of the grant
declarationCheckbox: I confirm that I will administer the estate of the person who died according to law, and that my application is truthful.
declarationCheckbox-intestacy: I confirm that I will administer the estate of the person who died according to law, and that my application is truthful.
submitWarning: Once you click ‘Save and continue’, you cannot change your answers.
submitWarning-multipleApplicants: Once everyone has agreed the legal statement and made their declaration, this information can’t be changed.
intestacyLegalStatementDeceased: That {deceasedName}, of {deceasedAddress}, was born on {deceasedDob} and died on {deceasedDod} intestate.
intestacyDeceasedMaritalStatus: They were {deceasedMaritalStatus} and domiciled in England and Wales.
intestacyDeceasedChildren: No children under 18 are entitled to the estate.
intestacyDeceasedEstateOutside: The deceased had assets overseas amounting to a net value of £{ihtNetValueAssetsOutside}.
intestacyDeceasedEstateLand: To the best of my knowledge, information and belief, there was no land vested in {deceasedName} which was settled previously to the death of {deceasedName} and which remained settled land notwithstanding such death.
intestacyDeceasedNotMarriedChildApplying: I am the lawfully adopted child of {deceasedName} and one of the people now entitled to share in the estate.
I am the child of {deceasedName} and one of the people now entitled to share in the estate.
I am the lawfully adopted child of {deceasedName} and the only person now entitled to the estate.
I am the child of {deceasedName} and the only person now entitled to the estate.
intestacyDeceasedMarriedSpouseRenouncing: {deceasedName}’s spouse or civil partner has given up the right to apply for letters of administration now or in the future. I am the lawfully adopted child of {deceasedName} and one of the people who may become entitled to share in the estate.

{deceasedName}’s spouse or civil partner has given up the right to apply for letters of administration now or in the future. I am the child of {deceasedName} and one of the people who may become entitled to share in the estate.

{deceasedName}’s spouse or civil partner has given up the right to apply for letters of administration now or in the future. I am the lawfully adopted child of {deceasedName} and one of the people entitled to share in the estate.

{deceasedName}’s spouse or civil partner has given up the right to apply for letters of administration now or in the future. I am the child of {deceasedName} and one of the people entitled to share in the estate.

{deceasedName}’s spouse or civil partner has given up the right to apply for letters of administration now or in the future. I am the lawfully adopted child of {deceasedName} and one of the people entitled to share in the estate.

{deceasedName}’s spouse or civil partner has given up the right to apply for letters of administration now or in the future. I am the child of {deceasedName} and one of the people entitled to share in the estate.
intestacyDeceasedMarriedSpouseApplyingHa: I am the lawful spouse or civil partner of {deceasedName} and one of the people now entitled to share in the estate.
I am the lawful spouse or civil partner of {deceasedName} and the only person now entitled to the estate.
intestacyLettersOfAdministration: I am applying for letters of administration. I have provided what I believe to be true and accurate information about {deceasedName}.

declarationCheckbox.required: Tick the check box to agree to the declaration
